se.jguru.nazgul.core.quickstart.api.analyzer

Class AbstractNamingStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.jguru.nazgul.core.quickstart.api.analyzer.AbstractNamingStrategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NamingStrategy

    public abstract class AbstractNamingStrategy
extends Object
implements NamingStrategy
    Abstract NamingStrategy implementation which contains some standard method implementations usable by all NamingStrategy subtypes.
    Author:
    Lennart Jörelid, jGuru Europe AB

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractNamingStrategy

        protected AbstractNamingStrategy(boolean prefixIsRequiredOnAllFolders)
        Creates a new AbstractNamingStrategy wrapping the supplied data.
        Parameters:
        prefixIsRequiredOnAllFolders - true if all folders are required to have names on the form projectPrefix-projectName-folderName. If false, then folder names should be on the form projectName-folderName instead.

    • Method Detail

      • createName

        public Name createName(org.apache.maven.model.Model model)
        The default implementation in AbstractNamingStrategy simply creates a Name by parsing the artifactId of the supplied model. (I.e. return Name.parse(model.getArtifactId());). Override this method if you need other ways to synthesize a Name from the supplied Model.
        Specified by:
        createName in interface NamingStrategy
        Parameters:
        model - A non-null Maven model.
        Returns:
        A Name created from the supplied Model.

      • getPomType

        public PomType getPomType(org.apache.maven.model.Model model)
                   throws IllegalArgumentException
        Retrieves the PomType for the supplied Model.
        Specified by:
        getPomType in interface NamingStrategy
        Parameters:
        model - A non-null Maven model.
        Returns:
        The PomType corresponding to the supplied Maven Model.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if a PomType could not be found from the supplied model. This implies that the Model did not follow the required naming patterns as implied by this NamingStrategy.

      • isPrefixRequiredOnAllFolders

        public boolean isPrefixRequiredOnAllFolders()
        Indicates if folders within a project must use names on the form projectPrefix-projectName-folderName, or if they instead must use the format projectName-folderName.
        Specified by:
        isPrefixRequiredOnAllFolders in interface NamingStrategy
        Returns:
        true if all folders are required to have names on the form projectPrefix-projectName-folderName. If false, then folder names should be on the form projectName-folderName instead.

      • resolvePomTypeForReactorPom

        protected PomType resolvePomTypeForReactorPom(org.apache.maven.model.Model model)
        Retrieves the PomType for a reactor POM with the supplied Model and Parent. The AbstractNamingStrategy implementation assumes that the ROOT_REACTOR POM uses a parent outside of its reactor and all other REACTOR POMs do not. This implies that the groupId of the supplied parent can be used to determine if the Model is crafted from a ROOT_REACTOR POM, according to the following algorithm: model.getGroupId().startsWith(parent.getGroupId()) Override this method to provide custom logic if your ROOT_REACTOR and REACTOR POMs are crafted in another way.
        Parameters:
        model - The (non-null) Maven Model of the reactor POM whose PomType should be created.
        Returns:
        the PomType for a reactor POM with the supplied Model and Parent.

      • isOtherParent

        protected boolean isOtherParent(org.apache.maven.model.Model model)
        Determines if the supplied model is a parent POM (but of an explicitly undefined type) or not. The AbstractNamingStrategy implementation assumes that all parent POMs use a naming strategy that implies that the last segment of the groupId for each parent POM is the end part of its corresponding artifactId. For example: 
             
         <groupId>se.jguru.nazgul.foo.poms.foo-api-parent</groupId>
         <artifactId>nazgul-foo-api-parent</artifactId>
        Override this method to provide custom logic if your parent POMs are crafted in another way.
        Parameters:
        model - The Maven Model of a parent POM.
        Returns:
        true if the supplied Model is to be considered a Parent POM.
